subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Ragetotem Arcanist
entries: Barbarian tribes who live in areas with strong spiritual energy may form a symbiotic relationship with these spirits who gain energy from their rage. In return they are able to cast many powerful and useful spells. As a custom each Barbarian crafts a unique totem to house their spirit and travel with them.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to channel your spiritual energy through your totem to cast spells from it. See 2024 PHB chapter 7 for the rules on spellcasting. The information below details how you use those rules as a Ragetotem Arcanist.

{@bold Cantrips.} You know three cantrips: {@spell Mending|XPHB} and two other cantrips of your choice from the Druid spell list (see that class's section for its list). {@spell Starry Wisp|XPHB} and {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB} are recommended. Whenever you gain a Barbarian level, you can replace one of your cantrips, except {@spell Mending|XPHB}, with another Druid cantrip of your choice. When you reach Barbarian level 10, you learn another Druid cantrip of your choice.

{@bold Spell Slots.} You can expend your totems charges (no action required) to convert them into spell slots in the moment of casting, equal to the number of charges expended up to a maximum as shown in the Charge Limit column of the Ragetotem Arcanist table.

{@bold Prepared Spells of 1st+ Level.} You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose three level 1 Druid spells. {@spell Cure Wounds}, {@spell Speak with Animals} and {@spell Thunderwave} are recommended. The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Barbarian levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Ragetotem Arcanist Spellcasting table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Druid spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Ragetotem Arcanist Spellcasting table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you can generate spell slots. For example, if you're a level 7 Barbarian, your list of prepared spells can include five Druid spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.
{@bold Changing Your Prepared Spells.} Whenever you gain a Barbarian level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Druid spell for which you can generate spell slots.
{@bold Spellcasting Ability.} Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Druid spells.
{@bold Spellcasting Focus.} You use your totem as a Spellcasting Focus for your Druid spells.
{@bold Rage.} You can casts spells while raging, but only through your totem. Casting a spell through the totem while raging counts as one of the actions you can take to extend it's duration.

{@bold Concentration.} When you cast as spell which requires concentration, while raging, your totem is concentrating on the spell instead of you. Any features which apply changes to concentration to you are applied to your totem instead.

{@bold Spell Origin.} When you cast a spell while raging, the totem casts the spell for you, using your spellcasting ability and proficiency bonus. The spell originates from the totem and the totem is the caster. When the totem casts a spell with a range of self, you can increased the range to touch, but it can only target you.

{@bold Components.} When you cast a spell through your totem, any components, except material components with a specified cost, are provided by your totem. You must provide components with a cost as normal. Vocal components are provided by the chanting of ancestral spirits. Somatic components are provided by complex movements of the totem. Non-costed material components are provided by them appearing as ghostly images around the totem.

subclassFeature.name: Level 3: Spellcharge
entries: The moment you enter your rage you emit spiritual energy which charges your totem with magic. For the duration of your rage, your totem becomes a {@creature Ragetotem|RagetotemArcanist|tiny magical construct}, and you can cast spells through it as long as it is within 60 feet of you and animated. The range increases as shown in the Range column of the Ragetotem Arcanist table.

The first time each rage you summon your totem, or charge it with magical energy, roll one ragedice. The totem gains a number of charges equal to the result, it can hold a maximum number of charges equal to twice your proficiency bonus. Any excess charges are lost.

The totem deanimates when it reaches 0 hit points, your rage ends, it runs out of charges or you use your bonus action to deanimate it. You can reanimate your totem by charging it with magical energy as a bonus action while raging. When it deanimates any charges it was holding are lost.

You can command your totem with your bonus action to cast {@spell mending|XPHB} on itself as a free action, restoring hit points equal to two rolls of your Rage Dice, or to charge itself with magical energy by expending a use of your rage. You can command your totem to move up to its speed without requiring an action. Additionally if the totem is under the effect of a spell which allows it to trigger an action you can command it to do so by spending the same action.

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Spiritbomb
entries: When the totem deanimates any charges it was holding are released in a magical explosion instead of being lost.

Target each hostile creature within a 20-foot Emanation centered on the totem. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes force damage equal to a number of ragedice equal to the charges it held (minimum 1). On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Level 6: Warrior Totem
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of the attacks with a casting of one of your Druid cantrips that has a casting time of an action.

subclassFeature.name: Level 10: Arcanists Presence
entries: You automatically succeed on saving throws against spells cast by your totem. Additionally while you are within 5 feet of a target, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against any spells cast by your totem.
Furthermore, when increasing the range of a self spell, you can increase the range to half the value in the Range column of the Ragetotem Arcanist table.

subclassFeature.name: Level 14: Overpowering Warrior Totem
entries: {@bold Violent Spellcasting}. Add your Strength modifier to the damage your totem deals with any Druid cantrip.
Additionally, you have honed a new way to attack furiously. The following effect is now among your Brutal Strike options.
{@bold Magical Blow.} You can replace this attack with a casting of one of your level 1 or level 2 Druid spells that has a casting time of an action.
